meanings.definition: The position or role of a manager.
meanings.sent1: Her managerships in the company were highly respected.
meanings.sent2: He was offered several managerships after completing his business degree.
meanings.sent3: The cat's managerships over the household included overseeing meal times.
meanings.sent4: In the jungle of office politics, her managerships were like a lion's roar.
meanings.sent5: The managerships of the team leader shone brightly during the project.

meanings.definition: The skill or practice of managing.
meanings.sent1: Effective managerships involve clear communication and problem-solving.
meanings.sent2: She honed her managerships through years of experience in the industry.
meanings.sent3: His managerships in juggling tasks amazed his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: Her managerships were a well-tuned orchestra, harmonizing different departments.
meanings.sent5: The art of managerships requires a balance of leadership and empathy.

meanings.definition: The authority or power of a manager.
meanings.sent1: The managerships of the CEO extended across all branches of the company.
meanings.sent2: With great managerships comes great responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The managerships of the principal were evident in the school's daily operations.
meanings.sent4: His managerships were like a shield, protecting his team from external pressures.
meanings.sent5: The managerships of the coach inspired the team to victory.
